title: When you update splash arts Riot...
body:
The idea is to improve them, not just change them for the hell of it. 

Some of the new ones like Nosferatu Vlad and Cottontail Teemo, are if anything worse than the original, Escpecailyl the Vlad one, it makes him look like a character from a cheap card game.

Look at Gentleman Cho, that was the chance to make it an 'actual' legendary skin, but instead the old splash art was just duplicated exactly and make a little cleaner and 'card-game-like'

Just because you have a new splash for a skin/champ doesn't mean you have to use it.

i am all in favour of updating badly drawn skins/splash's but I'm not a fan of change just for change's sake.
some champs like Darius didn't need a splash update, where champs like Skarner probably need it more.

And theres a whole lot of things, like changing the colour of Karthus' face, that are to put it simply... wrong.

apart from the 'bad-card-game' style of drawing that most of the new skin arts have, theres some really weird things too, like how come masquerade eve and vancouver ammumu are both on the same transmutation circle, when neither of them have anything to do with the alchemy scene or anything to do with eachother.

Don't get me wrong though, some new splashes are awesome like classic eve, kennen and swain. But i just ask that you compare the splashes before you switch them and ask not 'how old is this one compared to this one.' but 'how good is this one compared to this one.'

because some of the new splashes are just a mistake, and we can all see that.

we want change, but change for improvement, not change for the sake of change.

replies.body:
I agree about Darius, but damn his new splash art is awesome.

Rammus probably needs it the most.

EDIT: yes I did see the new splash arts. good to see my main eve get some love. rammus looks adorable :D

Hey dude,

Really cool to see you are enjoying some of the updated splash arts!

Just wanted to jump in here, we recently did a global unification of splash (not to be confused with updating splash art!)

You can read more about it here - 
http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/client-new-features-feedback/sT9ZIVzT-splashes-unifying-updating-and-you

But I will list some of the key points for you below;

> We had two major goals of the Unification:
> 
> Unify the representation of all characters to achieve global parity between splashes. A League of Legends champion shouldn’t be different solely due to where you are in the world. A consistent high quality splash should represent a character equally for all players.
> 
> Fix internal development issues. In line with making our work more efficient, we often analyze areas of redundancy to get rid of problem areas. Each time we have a new splash created, it’s typically an unruly amount of work to determine if a region should obtain the new splash, keep their own, get it into their build, etc. This can lead to things such as Tencent getting their patches a week later, which isn’t fair for their players, and has rippling impacts onto the eSports scene.

> Let’s be clear - many of these assets are not permanent, and don’t meet our quality bar. We had to make a decision on many splashes to take either one or the other- even when both weren’t great
Ahhhhh ok i see, thanks for clarifying that! keep up the good work! :)
New Skarner Splash art would be nice. I wonder if he'll be under Shurima. And will it have his passive crystal and maybe he'll be attacking someone with his tail.
